newsitem.title: UK: Cargo increase at London City airport Jan/Sept.
newsitem.headline: Cargo increase at London City airport Jan/Sept.

text.p: London City airport said it has seen its cargo traffic improve 92.5 percent In Jan-Sept compared with the first three quarters of 1996.
In a statement released here, the airport said destinations particularly contributing to cargo growth are Amsterdam, Dublin, Brussels, Paris and niche areas such as Eindhoven, Rotterdam and Malmo.

Martin Hawkes, station manager of Execair, the airport's main cargo handling agents said "Items being transported tend to be specialist products -- express documentation, high dependency medical supplies, even human organs for transplantation."

"It is not only passengers who benefits from the quick processing but very urgent items such as news films, breakdown spares and other time sensitive material can be processed and on their way faster than at any other London airport and of course, we are so much closer to the City and West End," he added.
